documents.document: Those migration figures are great today. Net arrivals over 70,000 in 2016. We will hit 5mil people before 2020!
@jordantcarter because the turbulence and some of the motivating passions have ugly echoes of the past.
Thank goodness the American republic has firmer foundations than Weimar did.

Anyhow short rant ends. 5/5
Maybe if it isn’t trade the misnomer shouldn’t be used anyway. Longer copyright terms aren’t “trade” just rent-seeking. 4/
Maybe one-size-fits-all isn’t actually the best way to do trade after all, if trade is meant to serve people. 3/
Maybe it’s quite natural to want to trade goods freely but keep regulatory systems that meet your own country’s needs. 2/
Maybe the global elite needs to rethink how they’ve been doing this “free trade” buzz 1/
@TouchMyPoly it’s so odd to see the pining for it.
Gym trainer at 0700 :(
